meanings.definition: A person who is young or youthful.
meanings.sent1: The playground was filled with joyful yewen playing together.
meanings.sent2: She always enjoyed spending time with the energetic yewen in her neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The wise old owl chuckled at the antics of the little yewen.
meanings.sent4: The forest seemed to come alive with the laughter of the yewen.
meanings.sent5: In the distance, the yewen's laughter echoed through the trees.

meanings.definition: To make or become young again.
meanings.sent1: The magical potion promised to yewen the aging process.
meanings.sent2: She hoped the fountain of youth would yewen her and bring back her vitality.
meanings.sent3: The scientist's experiment accidentally caused him to yewen into a child.
meanings.sent4: The sunrise seemed to yewen the world, bringing a fresh start to the day.
meanings.sent5: The artist's painting had the power to yewen the memories of the past.

meanings.sent1: The vibrant colors of the yewen clothing caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: She loved the yewen energy of the music at the concert.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy had a yewen spirit that was contagious.
meanings.sent4: The garden was filled with yewen flowers blooming in the spring.
meanings.sent5: Her laughter had a yewen quality that made everyone smile.
